channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: NPR's 2025 Books We Love is here. It's not your average year-end list
item.description: On Monday, NPR launched its end-of-the-year books guide. But Books We Love isn't a "top 10" list. Instead, it's more that 380 books that were personally recommended by members of the NPR staff.
item.content:encoded: On Monday, NPR launched its end-of-the-year books guide. But Books We Love isn't a "top 10" list. Instead, it's more that 380 books that were personally recommended by members of the NPR staff.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Israel assassinates a Hezbollah commander
item.description: Hezbollah is vowing a response after Israel killed its No. 2 commander in a Beirut neighborhood -- an assassination the group calls a "red line."
item.content:encoded: Hezbollah is vowing a response after Israel killed its No. 2 commander in a Beirut neighborhood -- an assassination the group calls a "red line."
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: As the ranks of hunters in the U.S. shrink, these kids are keeping tradition alive
item.description: The number of hunters in the U.S. continues to drop. Some states run events to get more kids interested in the sport. We join a pheasant hunt in Connecticut.
item.content:encoded: The number of hunters in the U.S. continues to drop. Some states run events to get more kids interested in the sport. We join a pheasant hunt in Connecticut.
item.dc:creator: Aine Pennello

item.title: Wisconsin residents express a split in views on health care costs
item.description: Democrats are highlighting concerns over health care costs in Wisconsin, a key swing state. The Trump administration says they have a plan of their own coming together to address health costs.
item.content:encoded: Democrats are highlighting concerns over health care costs in Wisconsin, a key swing state. The Trump administration says they have a plan of their own coming together to address health costs.
item.dc:creator: Chuck Quirmbach

item.title: What teens in New Jersey think about schools' cell phone restrictions
item.description: Many states and school districts now ban or restrict the use of cell phones in schools. But what do the kids think about this? Student journalists in New Jersey brought this question to their classmates and teachers.
item.content:encoded: Many states and school districts now ban or restrict the use of cell phones in schools. But what do the kids think about this? Student journalists in New Jersey brought this question to their classmates and teachers.
item.dc:creator: Janet W. Lee

item.title: Pediatrician weighs in on CDC's new vaccine guidance and what it means for parents
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Dr. James Campbell, an expert on childhood infectious diseases, about the CDC's new messaging on the relationship between vaccines and autism.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Dr. James Campbell, an expert on childhood infectious diseases, about the CDC's new messaging on the relationship between vaccines and autism.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Researchers shed new light on the mysterious death of a 13th-century duke
item.description: Researchers have uncovered DNA and forensic evidence that answers centuries-old questions about the killing of a 13th century Hungarian duke.
item.content:encoded: Researchers have uncovered DNA and forensic evidence that answers centuries-old questions about the killing of a 13th century Hungarian duke.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: For millennials, being a caregiver for family can come with unique challenges
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Jennifer Levin, author of Generation Care, about the roughly 10 million millennials working as family caregivers, often before they've fully formed their own lives.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks with Jennifer Levin, author of Generation Care, about the roughly 10 million millennials working as family caregivers, often before they've fully formed their own lives.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Pentagon investigates Arizona Sen. Mark Kelly after he appeared in Democrats' video
item.description: The Pentagon says it's opening an investigation into Arizona Sen. Mark Kelly in the wake of a video of Democratic lawmakers urging servicemembers not to comply with "illegal orders."
item.content:encoded: The Pentagon says it's opening an investigation into Arizona Sen. Mark Kelly in the wake of a video of Democratic lawmakers urging servicemembers not to comply with "illegal orders."
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: U.S. designates Venezuela's Cartel de los Soles a foreign terrorist organization
item.description: The U.S. has officially labeled Venezuela's Cartel de los Soles, allegedly led by President Nicolás Maduro and top officials, a foreign terrorist organization.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. has officially labeled Venezuela's Cartel de los Soles, allegedly led by President Nicolás Maduro and top officials, a foreign terrorist organization.
item.dc:creator: John Otis
